On Thu, 19 Aug 2004 13:51:50 -0700, John Arrowwood <jarrowwx@...> wrote:
> What do you guys think?  What have you done to deal with this problem?  Did
> you just tweak stuff until you got good results?  Or have you analyzed the
> problem and determined an optimal solution?

Well, if the problem really is as you've conceptualized it, that you
want to mutate a topology, then only perturb weights before adding new
topology, you could implement something similar to Colin's phased
approach.  Only instead of alternating phases of adding and
subtracting topology, you could have alternating phases of adding
topology and mutating weights only.

Otherwise, yeah, it sounds like it's just a matter of experimenting
and tweaking to find the appropriate mutation rate.

Derek
